de.dfki.lt.hfc

Class Proxy

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.dfki.lt.hfc.Proxy

  •  class Proxy
extends java.lang.Object
    information that is shared between equivalent patterns, even across rules
    Since:
    JDK 1.5

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected java.util.Set<int[]> delta
      the difference ("delta") that is given by set difference between new and old query result
      protected int[][] equalPositions
      encodes positions of (proper) duplicate variables in a local clause; e.g., leads to the following structure: [[0, 4], [1, 3]]; note that the sub-arrays are always *SORTED*; this information is
      protected int generation
      needed for clause/proxy resharing;
      protected java.util.Set<int[]> old
      the query result from the last iteration
      protected int[] properPositions
      duplicates are counted only once, using their FIRST occurrence; note that the int array is always *SORTED*; e.g., assuming that ?_ is a don't care variable, the proper positions for for are [0] (the first occurrence is used); same for , assuming a is an atom: [0]
      protected int[] relevantPositions
      proper variables are counted by their occurrence; note that the int array is always *SORTED*; e.g., assuming that ?_ is a don't care variable, the relevant positions for are [0, 2]; same for , assuming a is an atom: [0, 2]
      protected TIntArrayHashingStrategy strategy
      the equals and hash code strategy for the sets stored in table and delta
      protected java.util.Set<int[]> table
      the query result from the current iteration

      protected Proxy(Proxy proxy)
      copy contructor for copyRuleStore(); table, old, and delta are shallow copied, but everything else is taken over (incl.

      • table

        the query result from the last iteration

      • delta

        protected java.util.Set<int[]> delta
        the difference ("delta") that is given by set difference between new and old query result

      • generation

        protected int generation
        needed for clause/proxy resharing;
        See Also:
        Table.getGeneration(), ForwardChainer.executeLocalMatch()

      • equalPositions

        protected int[][] equalPositions
        encodes positions of (proper) duplicate variables in a local clause; e.g., leads to the following structure: [[0, 4], [1, 3]]; note that the sub-arrays are always *SORTED*; this information is

      • properPositions

        protected int[] properPositions
        duplicates are counted only once, using their FIRST occurrence; note that the int array is always *SORTED*; e.g., assuming that ?_ is a don't care variable, the proper positions for for are [0] (the first occurrence is used); same for , assuming a is an atom: [0]

      • relevantPositions

        protected int[] relevantPositions
        proper variables are counted by their occurrence; note that the int array is always *SORTED*; e.g., assuming that ?_ is a don't care variable, the relevant positions for are [0, 2]; same for , assuming a is an atom: [0, 2]

      • strategy

        protected TIntArrayHashingStrategy strategy
        the equals and hash code strategy for the sets stored in table and delta
